snippet: “The Case Against 8” documents the same-sex-marriage case that took four years to wind its way to the Supreme Court.
abstract: Film The Case Against 8 chronicles fight by directors Ben Cotner and Ryan White, gay men living in California, to overturn their state's 2008 ballot measure Proposition 8 which denied right of same-sex couples to marry; film follows court case that took four years to wind its way to the Supreme Court; documentary has gone on to theatrical release after winning directing award at Sundance and will appear on HBO in June.
lead_paragraph: “The Case Against 8” documents the same-sex-marriage case that took four years to wind its way to the Supreme Court.

headline.seo: Long Road for ‘The Case Against 8,’ About Same-Sex Marriage
headline.main: A Tale That Nearly Had No End
headline.print_headline: A Tale That Nearly Had No End

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
